Reviews.Title: “what a joke”
Reviews.Author: cowley_traveller
Reviews.Content: Beware of the cheap price and the rather stylish exterior as that is about the only 'good' at this place. The room was tiny and cramped and we had to ask for a chair which was non existent at our desk. We were brought a chair and I wouldn't even allow a street person to sit on it as it had very unpleasant stains on it. Apparently another traveler also had to ask for a chair - hmmm - chairs aren't that expensive to have in a standard room are they? Oh yes, forget the 'supposedly' free wi-fi - you have to pay for that service even if you have your own computer. I can understand paying at the some of the high-end resorts, but come on, even Motel 6 offers free wi-fi. Oh yes, the breakfast - Otis Spunkmeyer muffins, pre-packaged - no wonder we are a nation of obese people. Sorry, but I'll pay more and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “scald, cold shower”
Reviews.Author: admice900
Reviews.Content: I made a point to go here beacuse it was cheaper and I liked one in Calabasas ahwile ago. All Motels are too expensive anyway. Took a shower and suddenly got scalding hot, then too cold TWICE. First they were gonna have maintenance check it. Then offered me another room. I said I don't need another shower, I want a discount. The manager did offer a refund, but there are no other cheaper, better hotels in the area. I said I want a discount. He agreed to 25%, but when I checked out in the morning, did not reflect the discount. The clerk said shed have a manager call when they got in. NO call of course. I'm not a scammer, they should have compensated me for the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Reginald S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sylmar location for 2.5 weeks and enjoyed every nights there... The room was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the rates was a great for my budget... And who could go without the lovely continental breakfast that was served every morning.... If you're looking for a nice, peaceful community that is close to nearby restaurants and gas stations then definately consider Good Nite Inn Sylmar!!! Reginald S. Shreveport, LA

Reviews.Title: “Good Nite Inn Sylmar is the way to go!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia M
Reviews.Content: Driving to Orange County to visit family we needed an inexpensive but clean and safe place to stay. We remember the Good Nite Inn. Went on their website and found them to be the most affordable yet clean and safe looking. We arrived late around 9:30 p.m. to find a well lighted Inn and parking area. A security guard was patroling the parking lot who was friendly and courteous and made us feel secure. We were tired and it was nice to be greeted by a very nice young front desk lady. The room was beyond what I expected for the price older but very clean. The towels were great. We had a good nites sleep and in the morning enjoyed the great complimentary Coffee and muffins. Will definately stay here again when needed and recommend to friends. In these tough economic times it feels good to be given a fair price and treated right.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Saula D
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly. Sarah at the front desk attitude is amazing! she is very helpfull and friendly. would stay at good nite inn anytime if you are looking for a cheap hotel choose good nite at Sylmar.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap price, large room, good location”
Reviews.Author: popcrnluvr
Reviews.Content: This is right next to a busy freeway, but for the price and location it was really good. It is a budget hotel, so not a lot of frills, but if you are looking to go to the LA area and can't afford a lot, this is your place. It is right next door to a Denny's and McDonald's is right across the street, so if you want a late night snack, it can't be bet. Our room was large, but our bathtub was not so good condition. The bed was a little lumpy, but I am sure we could have ask for another room, but remember this is a budget hotel. We stayed about 13 days there, we didn't use the internet, but I understand it is too expensive a cost to use anyway. Every morning they have muffins and juice and coffee in office. For the money, beings that it is LA, it wasn't bad, but if you have dogs, you can stay next door at Motel 6 for a little more, good place to stay also. You have to ask for things like toilet paper, which is unbelievable, but it is what it is. If you are going to stay long, you might want to consider the Motel 6 next door, better service and nicer rooms, just a little higher.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap option but you need a car to go to LA”
Reviews.Author: Danielle_saopaulo
Reviews.Content: Its clean and our room was neat and the painting seamed pretty new. But there was no refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer or iron and the breakfast was just muffins, coffee and orange juice. The jacuzzi was nice but the place is too far away if you are looking forward to enjoy LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, good service and large clean room”
Reviews.Author: mptopham
Reviews.Content: Be under no illusions, this is a budget motel next to a busy freeway. Nut having said that it is very cheap. The service we received was great from the front desk, we were able to check in early and they moved our room no problem when we weren't happy with the first one. The room was large and clean. The bed was a bit soft and the pillows not overly comfortable but these things were minor. If you are looking for somewhere which is very good value for a night or 2 then you won't do much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Good Nite Inn”
Reviews.Author: 322NotHappy
Reviews.Content: Good Nite Inn?! Yeah right..Woke up to bed bug bites all over!! Never again!!

Reviews.Title: “We got beaten by bedbugs:-(”
Reviews.Author: Dream4ik
Reviews.Content: It's a horrible place, we got beaten by bedbugs. We actually cought couple. My friends got bumps all over the body from the bites, and it's deffinetly not a good feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: btointheeto
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the bare minimum requirements of a hotel. No fridge, no microwave, no table or chairs. Our room didn't even have tissues. Both the room and bathroom smelled a little. The floor was dirty. The bed was stiff so it caused soreness. The water pressure in the shower was low and the temperature turned ice cold after five minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Be ready to sleep with insects.”
Reviews.Author: frank_hm
Reviews.Content: We were here for a overnight stay en route to Las Vegas. 1. The reception and speed of check in was acceptable and not very bad. 2. The room was infested with insects and roaches. The bedsheets were stained. The room had a foul odor and was suffocating. 3. Parking space was free, ample and available. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal!”
Reviews.Author: gjk15
Reviews.Content: Our Family spent 3 nights At Good Nite Inn Sylmar. We used 2 rooms. The rooms are clean. This is a modest Budget venue. With that in mind. The lighting is adequate. The pool and spa were clean. The public areas were well maintained. There is some noise with Interstate 5 Northbound just over the wall from you. The traffic subsides early enough and the sound wall with a "FULL" parking lot does afford expected resolution to the noise potential. There is a Denny's family style restaurant right next to the property. There is a MacDonalds directly across the street from the property. A small refrigerator would be a nice addition but adequate ice and basic vending shoud suit most travelers. Any one who chooses could be critical. 5 Star? The Good Night is not! But in it's class, it is an outstanding value. Clean! and convenient! The staff is exceptional! They are willing to mitigate any problem you have immediately with in reasonable bounds. We stayed to a "Full House"! Families with children were expected and families with children abound yet the customers were all well disciplined. We always try to identify one employee who sets the standard for the establishment when we visit. We suggest you look for Sara with NO H! She has a genuine constant smile and sincerely cares that you are happy. We saw her deal with a pair of guests that wouldn't have been pleased if they were at the Ritz Carlton! If you are not happy at the Ritz Carlton type, do the rest of the world a favour and stay away from Good Nite Inn Sylmar when I am on the road...Thank you Sara. We were well rested, the latrine areas were clean. The furnishings were adequate. The air conditioner worked! The towels were as soft as those towels could be. Sheets were clean. The carpet did have one stain but not everyone helps take care of our carpets, do they Mr. Hernandez? Thank You Sara, (No H). See ya next time we need access to the North Los Angeles, Hollywood, Santa Clarita Areas....

Reviews.Title: “OK If Low Cost is the Main Concern”
Reviews.Author: SoCal_Visitor
Reviews.Content: If all you need is a bed and a television, and not much more, the hotel is tolerable; it could easily be better. Staff was friendly. Room lighting is institutional and depressing. The plastic cover on the mattress is probably a good idea, but left me sweating. Many damaged surfaces. Sparse linens. Overall fairly clean except in the corners and behind the bed. A nice, small pool, but the whirlpool water was green. Good location for access to LA and Magic Mountain. Skip the â€œbreakfastâ€� - McDonalds and Dennyâ€™s are adjoining. Internet service is extra. The parking lot was a mixture of decent cars, a few motorcycles, and some rough looking characters. Itâ€™s OK for a short night stay, but I wouldnâ€™t want to live there.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Snigdha11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husbad for one day. Its a nice budget hotel ... in our room no noise was coming from highway. Room was quite comfortable and clean ..the only small issue we had was we got queen bed room which was not that much comfortable but was manageable. Overall i will definitely recommend this hotel... more than what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay at again!”
Reviews.Author: kimberlyc52
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived and tried to check in the clerk told me to wait for the next guy to come in because his shift was almost over and I had to watch him stand there for anpther 15 minutes. Then when the other employee started his shift he could not find my reservation on the computer even though I made it 3 weeks ago on the good nite inn website! After waiting another 20 minutes I finally received my room key and walked to my room only to find my "non smoking" room smelled like smoke and there were cigarette burns on the sheets. To add to the smell the bathroom had a strong odor that smelt like bug poison. There were yellow/orange stains on the floor, tub and toilet. Not to mention the tub had a large crack in the side.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and information”
Reviews.Author: Alexfang
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, I had a good trip with my family because of their help. It is very useful for my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a few nights but very noisy & uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: kai_stafford
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here for our holiday to Los Angeles for 2 weeks. Expedia say this place is In a good location to vist L.A. - The motel is situated right next to the No5 Freeway and is so noisy that sleeping is almost impossible. We did complain about our room and was moved to a quieter room at the back of the hotel. Great! Erm... not so great as the walkways outside the room are often used as late night hangouts with people smoking and we heard a guy selling drugs outside our room one night. There are big gaps around the door so even with the door shut and towel shoved at the bottom of the door it still sounded like they were in our room. The location is ok if your visiting 6 Flags or Universal Studios but miles away from anything else! All that is in walking distance is a petrol station, a Dennys & a McDonalds. If you need to 'pop to the supermarket' (or anywhere else) expect at least a half an hour drive. Another reason why we booked this hotel was because it had a pool and 'spa'. We didnt use either once. Check out our pictures to see why! We were only in the room at night when we were completely exhausted after exploring L.A all day long but I would seriously recommend avoiding this place. At weekends it seems its a place where the locals come to party, play their music REAL loud until 6am and deal drugs. Its ok for a few nights but if your staying in L.A for a while look for a good hotel near West Hollywood. This place felt really unsafe and the hotel room didnt even have a safe, neither did the hotel lobby (we ended up carrying around our valuable items all holiday). AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: zzzyzzz
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stay at Good Nite Inn Sylmar, and I'm very happy to have better experience with it. This round I was staying at Room #101, it is spacious for all of us (4 adults) ! We felt happy the very moment stepped in the room. The washing area is bigger than expected. The bathroom is clean and pretty up kept. It would be better if it comes with fridge and coffee maker, but no a big deal for missing it. The only negative side is the room is right next to some kind of engine room (central air con?), so there's a constant humming sound through the day and night. We can feel the vibration over the wall especially when the engine started. It takes a while for us to get used to it, anyway we were able to sleep. I'm not sure if anything could be done to reduce the noise/vibration, anyway it kind of work out for us. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends, and I'm sure will be back for third stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice price and close to where I wanted to be”
Reviews.Author: dsank123
Reviews.Content: I travel to LA a few times a year and tried the Good Nite Inn for the first time. The front desk was really helpful and check in was quick. The room was what I expected - basic but very clean. The pool was a plus and the Denny's right next door was very convenient. The 5 freeway is right behind the hotel but sound wasn't that big of a deal. Overall, good stay and I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome deal!”
Reviews.Author: ImKlem1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited sunny California (from New York State) to attend our daughter's wedding near LA. The proximity to the freeway was the first thing I found very attractive about The Good Nite Inn. Secondly, since we were on motorcycles, we always like a room where we can view them from our window. The staff was extremely congenial, happily providing us with everything we needed. Although we never had any issues needing attention, I saw staff constantly, whether carrying towels to someone or a wrench to repair something, clearly they were there to help. Notes to the cleaning staff (I like extra washcloths and don't like my top sheet or blanket tucked in) were always carefully honored. Oh, yes! The pool was kind of cool (it WAS May, after all), but the hot tub was soooooooo wonderful! Obviously cleaned daily. I don't think you could possibly find a better deal for the money! By the way, I am a front desk clerk for a motel in New York State, and I travel quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Decent low frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: OceansideGino
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at the good nite inn a few times because i take courses in the nearby city of granda hills but i live in oceanside a few hours away. this hotel is in a great location and perfect for my situation. first off the price of the room is ridiculously low for being so close to los angeles. i dont think i have ever payed more than $60 for a room after sales tax. you cant beat it. front desk/lobby/breakfast area was small but the clerk at the desk was very helpful and i enjoy grabbing a coffee and muffin and chit chatting with the morning girl. the contential breakfast is just muffins/coffee/juice, but i i know for a fact that the motel 6 next store doesnt offer that. so no complaints from me. as far as the room, its no frills and basic. i usually ask for a room that has been renovated and a recent carpet wash and they hook it up. televisions and furniture are a little dated, but again the price is so low, i didnt expect flat screens and designer furniture. the digital air conditioner is a life saver in the summer. all in all i have nothing bad to say about the good nite inn>

Reviews.Title: “Affordable”
Reviews.Author: tinnyschoice
Reviews.Content: This Hotel may not be the Hilton or Marriott, but it is better equiped than Motel 6...I enjoy the people who work there and the Reservation clerks Malinda and Sara are off the chain when it comes to Customer Service... Way to Go Good Nite Inn.../..

Reviews.Title: “Good Nite for a GREAT rate. Can you say Bargain?”
Reviews.Author: randyrambo
Reviews.Content: I am a bargin hunter and this place really stands out because of the great nightly rate. Check in was quick and the front desk / day manager recommended a really good italian buffet which wasnt too far from the hotel which i ate at twice during my stay. It might be from the low prices, but this small hotel seems suprisingly busy. There was alot of traffic at the desk anytime i needed to speak to a desk clerk and the other people staying at this hotel seemed so friendly and energetic. One lady even offered to buy me a peach smoothie from dennys next store. Random right? The hotel looks well kept and aside from the dingy green carpet walled elevator (green carpet? really?) this place could really pass as a decent 4 or 5 star bed and breakfast or something. It is alsolocated right off the freeway which is always great. but I was given a room on the freeway side which i kind of didn't want because before checking in i took a moment to read the reviews there were alot about loud highway noise. Need less to say, the Freeway noise was minimal and once i got in my room i didnt notice it at all. The room was pleasantly quiet and clean however the decor, furniture and bathroom sink area needed a major renovation. For $50 a night, i can deal with a tacky light fixture and old school night stand. I really didnt mind. In fact, major kudos to the hotel staff for keeping this old building and hotel room looking fresh. All in all, i enjoyed my stay and i got a great price on my room. I wont hesitate to stay there if i am ever in the area again. By the way, i stay in alot of "regular joe" priced motels(ie motel 6, goodnite inns) and i gotta say by far this hotel has the best cable television selection of channels.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: suzanabananna
Reviews.Content: The reason for out trip was to take the kids to Six Flags. The location was very good but the room was..... Well, disgusting! Mold and mildew in the bathrooms, and I highly doubt that they actually cleaned the tub or shower or even swept & mopped. They provided toilet paper (the one that was on the roll) but we had to remove it from the roller because the roller didnâ€™t work. When we did run out of toilet paper I had to go to the office and ask for more. The beds were made but we felt very uncomfortable to actually get under the covers scared to see what we would find! No TV remote so we had to stand there and change the channels manually. Carpet was filthy; paint on the wall was chipping & spotted. Very dirty! For $43 dollars a night, I guess thatâ€™s what you get. We were pleased and thought we found a bargin when we found the rooms online but it was NOT WORTH IT! Buyer beware!!! Stay elsewhere if you expect cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel2533
Reviews.Content: Very large room, great air conditioner, right next door to Denny's, Great value would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Worst buggiest stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Ymedel
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the place looks nice and all has a nice presentaion. Pool is clean jaccuzi is dirty as hell. Cozy beds, but through out the night bugs come out. This hotel is infested with bed bugs. Could not sleep for anything I killed about 10 bed bugs no joke. And the leave marks on ur skin which itch they bite. I would not recommend this place yeah it's cheap in price but I rather pay more next time and not have to worry about bed bugs crawling up my feet or arms it's gross.

Reviews.Title: “Pay the extra $$ for a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Vaca7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a quick trip to Six Flags and I found this hotel for $40 on their website..the cheapest a place close to Six Flags. It was cheap all around! The carpet was disgusting and my husband and I both kept our socks on. The decor was cheap and the walls were thin. We kept the TV on all night so we couldn't hear the highway traffic passing. The bed was hard and the headrest looked gross so we ended up sleeping in the middle of the bed. I did not leave his side for fear of something crawling on me. We recently took a trp to Florida and paid $30 for a La Quinta room and it was renovated and everything...this hotel was seriously scary! We were on the top floor and I was afraid we were going to fall through! We debated about getting a different hotel room, but since we only stayed 1 night we managed. We will never stay here again...worst place I've ever been. The staff was not the best, but not the worst either!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, ok stay except for last night!”
Reviews.Author: RandRSeeker21
Reviews.Content: I did not experience what all the others explained in their reviews. I stayed for four nights on the third floor. The room was pretty mediocre but that was to be expected for the price, but the bathroom was terrible, it had mold, the ceiling was cracked the drain had rust, the water would change temperatures while showering, there would be static on the television when I walked around the room. Im a trooper, I can handle a lot, but I packed my items at 4:30 in the morning when I discovered TWO BED BUGS in one of the beds the last night of my stay. When I relayed this to the front desk, the attendant did not seem surprised of the problem, I was simply given a card and told to call the manager. I also had a room right next to the elevator and could hear everything passing. Compared to all the other reviews, I am hoping that maybe I just got a bad room. The only thing I liked was the hotel was not far from all of my destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: AndigirlHawaii
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed at on our vacation, and we enjoyed our stay here! Close to Six Flag's, and there are lots of places to eat in the vacinity. They have a very courteous and helpful staff and lots of free parking! I will definitely stay here again! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “True to it's name..”
Reviews.Author: denthead
Reviews.Content: I work offshore, and find myself in hotel/motels more than I want. On the night I stayed here, I used a coupon book to locate a competitor,..but when I saw the place I ran as fast as I could!! I saw the Good Nites Inn, and checked in and right away, it was obvious that this was a well run place. The staff professional and courteous, the rooms in great condition. I am a light sleeper, and noises distract me, so the the first night, I had issues with the freeway noise. Abraham the manager on duty, and his staff, took care of the problem quickly and moved me. The morning chat with the staff while getting coffee, juice and muffin was pleasant and clinched the deal that I would only stay here, when I am in town. The greatest thing..it was 20 dollars cheaper than the crack hotel I originally saw in the coupon/traveler book.

Reviews.Title: “great customer service”
Reviews.Author: cutelolo_15
Reviews.Content: front desk was very helpful and quick. hotels were nice and clean

Reviews.Title: “SMC Astronomy Club Approves”
Reviews.Author: ealonzo
Reviews.Content: Im currently a member of the Astronomy o3 club at smc and this hotel is perfect for a cheap clean stay. Its nearby some secluded places for stargazing yet near a city where one can go eat and enjoy the day, hell theres a dennys and a mcdonalds right next door! what more does a starving student want.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Good Nite.”
Reviews.Author: kate_n_ian
Reviews.Content: I booked this room because of the excellent price & the free parking. There is a Denny's next door & a McDonald's across the way, as well as a gas station close by. We were about a 20 minute drive from Universal Studios, so the location is pretty good. The hotel is right next to the freeway, but with the door and window shut, the noise was minimal. Upon arrival, we waited to check in for about 25 minutes...and there were only 2 groups ahead of us. It didn't seem that the check in lady had any sense of urgency at all...she was slowly checking everyone in. However, she was nice, so it's okay. The hotel looked pretty nice from the outside...the pool area looked good and the parking lot felt safe. The elevator was a bit musty & scary...we ended up taking the stairs the rest of the time. When we entered our NON SMOKING room, I was taken aback by the stench of cigarettes & cleaning supplies. It smelled like the room hadn't been aired out in months. I immediately turned on the bathroom fan, air conditioner, and opened the windows, and it seemed to help a bit. However, the smell in the bathroom was even worse...like a combination of cleaning supplies and a moldy drain. I actually resisted using the bathroom until I absolutely had to simply because of the smell. The bed felt unclean, and there were cigarette burns in the plastic that covered the mattress. While I was sitting on the bed watching TV, I found a small black bug on my arm, and that pretty much did it for me as far as using the sheets were concerned. I thanked God that I brought my own pillow & slept ontop of the sheets. The sink in the bathroom turned on if you turned the knobs both left and right, so it was tough finding that magic "in-between" spot that wouldn't leave the sink dripping all night. I had to sleep with the windows open because the smell of the room was literally making my stomach churn. There are no safety mechanisms on the windows, so I felt a bit unsafe doing this, but I didn't have a choice. Also, this made the sound of the freeway deafening. I don't think I've ever had a worst night's sleep at a motel/hotel. Checkout was prompt and the checkout lady was very nice. All in all, you get what you paid for. I would never stay here again, and would never recommend this motel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “good for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: mikayla73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night for a quick stop while on our way to OC from central California. It was a clean "no frills" place to sleep that was inexpensive. Our room was on the back side facing the freeway and with the door shut, we couldn't hear the noise. The bed was a little firm for me. Denny's is right next to the motel so we ate dinner there (it was actually suprisingly good). McDonald's is right across the street. The staff was friendly when we were checking in/out. We would stay here again for a quick, inexpensive stay.

Reviews.Title: “Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: califmac
Reviews.Content: The area isn't all as some other reviews suggest...it's a typical, off Interstate place to stay. We stayed there for three nights. Everything was as advertised. Parking was safe and the staff was very nice and were very helpful. Since we have the habit of using our own bed sheets--as everyone should do--our stay was very comfortable and there wasn't as much Interstate road noise as I expected. I would stay there again; mostly because when we stay in Hotels/Motels...we don't spend time in our rooms, we just sleep there, get up and go out. I didn't have any problems.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for !”
Reviews.Author: LastminTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking for me. For the price (budget) it fit my needs of what turned out to be two days at Six Flags Magic Mountain and a day/night trip to Hollywood then Universal Studios. The room was reasonably clean but somewhat noisy being near the pool. But hey it was not intolerable as we used the pool ourselves. For the location it was a fairly short trip to Hollywood checked out the sights then hit Universal Studios on the way back. Six Flags Magic Mountain was equally convenient to get to just up the freeway. Bed was a little firm, towels are scratchy ,maid forgot wash cloths once , typical woes of all budget priced motels. Front desk very friendly,area felt secure.

Reviews.Title: “VERY far from downtown L.A”
Reviews.Author: nicolepettersen
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel, its more like a motel. Located off a busy highway. The kind of place where people stay for one night. The rooms were reasonably comfortable with TV etc... but very dated decor and no room cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “The Good Nite Inn - The Only Place For Me”
Reviews.Author: TheOriginalStealth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Good Nite Inn for the month of June 2009...that's right sports fans the entire month. The hotel is clean, management is "Jonny On The Spot" with problems, it's a safe environment, the girls at the front desk are HOT and it's very cost effective. My last weekend in June something went wrong with my sink and management went above and beyond to make sure that I was comfortable! True professionalism. Needless to say I will be staying there whenever I am in Sylmar. Great Job Guys!

Reviews.Title: “This place needs to be cleaned and renovated.”
Reviews.Author: letsgotravelasap
Reviews.Content: We found a dead roach in a drawer. The bath tub was not clean and bathroom needs cosmetic repair. We ended up canceling our reservation and transferring to another hotel. The staff was helpful but the place was just not up to par.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD NITE INN SYLMAR HAS THE "WOW" FACTOR”
Reviews.Author: chantier
Reviews.Content: Myself and two teenage daughters stayed here for three nights in April. Did not know what to expect as this place was such a bargain and we were on a very tight budget. I NEED NOT HAVE WORRIED. We were greeted by friendly staff who showed us to our room.A large, spotlessly clean room with multi channel TV. Internet access was available at a reasonable cost.A continental breakfast was also available. The room was cleaned daily by friendly staff and we were given lots of information on local attractions and even had maps printed off and given to us by the lovely receptionist, Janiefer. This hotel is ideal if you are looking for budget accommodation and excellent value for money. I would definitely stay here again should we return to LA in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Economical Long term”
Reviews.Author: MdtravelCentralCoast
Reviews.Content: This place is great to stay for an extended stay. The office personnel have been exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable and comfortable...”
Reviews.Author: Sumu07
Reviews.Content: We were there for 3 nights and needless to mention, the stay at Good Nite added to the comfort and pleasure. The location is perfect and is not very far from the tourist attractions ( Universal / Hollywood ). The rooms are reasonably priced and the service is excellent. Looking forward to stay in Goodnite on my next leisure trip to Sandiego.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: c_los0120
Reviews.Content: i stayed there 2 nites and i mean everything went well with this hotel,,, it was calm and the best was the customer service. when im around that area again im gonna stay there again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! PERFECT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean cheap motel,great value”
Reviews.Author: Mike007a
Reviews.Content: This a great value motel, next to the highway, a few restaurants nearby. Ask for a room facing the pool, so you don't have to listen to the highway traffic all night , I had to change rooms it was so loud. I would stay here again.I booked this room through Hotels.Ca ( and saved a lot by paying in Canadian funds)You have to have a car to stay here. Its about 40 Minutes north of LA so leave early if you have to go anywhere as there is so much traffic all day. The hot tub is very nice after a long day on your feet,and the pool is cold.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty quiet for the location....pretty good deal.”
Reviews.Author: blissfulmtgal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed next door at the Motel 6 and it has been sooo noisy I could hardly sleep. This was much more quiet and more upscale for a little more money. I was glad to find it. The night clerk was a little robotic until I found a common ground with him; then he talked my ear off. He could be a little warmer from the get go. The morning clerk was geniune and a treat. Thanks for the coffee and pastries, and the nice smile to start my busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: forevermelissa81
Reviews.Content: Not bad for the price clean room nice staff close to alot of places

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: bodenseher
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night because it was the cheapest/closest option next to Six Flags. Staff was friendly, hot tub could be warmer, some nasty smell after AC was turned on for the first time. Ask for Six Flags coupons at the office.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing PLace to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: crazyk8911
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an amazing place to stay. Straight off the 5/405 freeways. Only 20 minutes into Hollywood. Perfect for those on a budget. Staff were super friendly. Gave us all sorts of info and advice. Room was clean and comfortable...amazing cable TV and wireless for guest use. Free coffee and pastries in the morning was a bonus!! I highly reccommend to anyone travelling to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Good Nite Inn in Sylmar California”
Reviews.Author: CALIF347
Reviews.Content: I just spent 24 days at the Good Nite Inn in Sylmar California and the staff was wonderful. The room was very comfortable and was cleaned everyday. The hotel is right off the interstate so travel is very easy. Restaurants are in walking distance. And parking is very easy and secure. Cab fare from LAX is $90.00 so it is best to grab a rental car from the airport and drive straight to it. Don't worry about getting lost because it is easy to find and in LA you will love having a car to get around in. If you do manage to get turned around or confused you still do not have to worry because the staff will gladly help you find your way. Would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “hum.”
Reviews.Author: Celelia
Reviews.Content: As I read the reviews I wonder what do people need to be comfortable and satisfied? I stayed in Good Night in for 8 nights in April-May 2008. I was pleasantly surprised! Even tho the sink was outside the bathroom and our first rooms AC broke down, it was still a pleasant and nice stay. Bed was comfortable, shower was nice and about everything worked. The staff was nice and helpful. We stayed on the freeway side at first and that was noisy, but after our AC broke down we switched rooms to one next to the pool and there was no noise at all. I enjoyed my stay very much. Only bad thing about Good Night Inn is it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Not Wheelchair Accessible”
Reviews.Author: rs_18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Good Nite Inn with my girlfriend and 5 year old daughter. When I made the reservations I asked for a wheelchair accessible room with 2 beds. I was told there are no rooms with 2 beds that are wheelchair accessible. But we reserved the room anyways. Since The Good Nite Inn does not provide cots, we decided to have my daughter sleep on an air mattress we brought from home. When we arrived and saw the room we were shocked. It wasn't even almost wheelchair accessible. My manual wheelchair did not fit in the tiny bathroom, and there was no roll in shower. I had a difficult time washing my hands since my legs did not fit under the sink. I could barely fit my wheelchair in between the TV stand and the bed (which is the way to the bathroom). When we blew up the twin size air mattress for my daughter, there was no room for me to move around. I was stuck in one place. If I would have known the wheelchair accessible rooms were that small, I would have asked for a regular room on the first floor with 2 beds. If you are in a wheelchair, I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away... Roaches in bed”
Reviews.Author: travelingemi
Reviews.Content: If I am taking my time to review this hotel is because I want to warn you, this hotel is just a dump. You are better off slepping under a bridge. The staff is rude, the grounds dirty, the pool and jacuzzi not operational. Then to make matters worst the room had a dead roaches on the bed. I couln't stay in that place. When I tried to get my money back after only five minutes in the room, they refused to refund me the money. I learned my lesson cheaper is not wiser. Believe me!

Reviews.Title: “some problems”
Reviews.Author: shashemis
Reviews.Content: when i booked ($45 /night ) this hotel was supposed to have wireless internet ,hair dryer ,microwave and ... â€Ž when i arrived i had to change 4 rooms to get wireless signal and as i spoke to them i understood that they knew â€Žwhich room get the signal and which doesnâ€™t.â€Ž awful chemical smell in rooms whenever entered the room .â€Ž i had 30 nights stay but on my 28 night stay when i got back from shopping i could not open the door because they â€Žsaid that they did not know i booked 30 days even though i paid full 30 days up front.â€Ž when i tried to be nice and said dont need housekeeping and need just towels they forget to give me what i needed.â€Ž my next stay was at another Inn $240 / week and even though they had the same problems but this one was much â€Žcheaper that good nite Inn.â€Ž overall was not that bad but the same price i could have get a better place as i did in san Antonio ($40/night ) my â€Žhotel in san Antonio was equipped with kitchen and iron and hair dryer and...â€Ž

Reviews.Title: “really bad room”
Reviews.Author: rosierobles77
Reviews.Content: I know the saying you pay for what you get! That is so true I got a really good deal online for the room but boy was i surprised when we got into the room. Carpets dirty, sheets as thin as paper not to mention the towels ( you would need four to do the job of one good thick towel and one room of toliet paper. Wait till you open the bathroom door. I guess now i know what maybe a really cheap hotel would look like. I had heard good reviews about this Good Nite Inn but I will tell you I will NEVER STAY in another. the tube was stained mildew around the walls and if you like hot showers this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “GoodNite Sylmar - A Traveller Nighte Mare”
Reviews.Author: Biz_Travel68
Reviews.Content: I've stayed for one night on a business trip in Good Nite Inn in Sylmar at 12835 Encinitas Avenue Sylmar, CA 91342 This is by far the worst motel I ever been to, and I do travel a lot. Few of the many reasons that put it in this category: 1) A non smoking room which is actually a smoking room with a lot of perfume 2) A completely ruined bathroom, so bad that they had to cover it with rubber rugs 3) Roaches in the room 4) Generally dirty in the room and the premises 5) Terrible service at the service desk 6) Water system that is working very badly ( both taps and plumbing) It has been a VERY bad experience, and I do not recommend anyone for any price ( which is usually low) to stay there. There are other low-cost motels which are quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Good-nite”
Reviews.Author: sweetp64
Reviews.Content: Hi name is Clayton Ramclam from Henderson, Nevada i haved been staying with the good-nite Inn Sylmar , California for almost two (2) years , and most likely for the 3 to 4 yrs to come., at least a minium of two (2) night a week . i must say the the staff their is very polite , very very taughtful , and helpful it makes my staying their a joyful one .i always look forward to come down once a week to spend my two nights or longer with the great staff heading up by Mrs. Tamara Tolbert. one of the very nice young lady ms. Andrea always make sure that my room is alway ready on my check-in mostly on monday's and as early as possible, Andrea is a plesant AND A VERY NICE person that you'll got working for your company. ps: i recently had the pleasure of meeting the new business manager their at the Sylmar, California. Mrs. Tamara Tolbert WOW what a classy Person she is. she took the time to talked to me and explain all of the new upgrade that is going on at the Sylamr , California site i am so proud of her and the new upgrade with all of the rooms. please feel free to contact me anytime at [--], or email me at cramclam@aol.com too.. thanks to all the staff keep up the good job!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: SunsetCoaster
Reviews.Content: Very ordinary budget motel, so you have to go in with that in mind. Room was adequately clean but tired and in need of refurbishment. The bathtub drain was completely blocked in our room, meaning we showered with water up to mid-shins. We mentioned this to the front room staff. Important thing to take note - it's very close to the freeway. If you're a light sleeper like me, and you have to stay here, ask for a room in the back. Otherwise it'll be anything but a 'goodnite' sleep. Even with being in the back, I was awoken a few times by especially loud and heavy trucks. I could not imagine trying to sleep in one of the rooms right on the freeway - a mere stone's throw. We were also awoken at 1:00 a.m. by very noisy late arrivals who didn't bother speaking quietly or controlling their yelling, running kids. I suppose this could happen anywhere, but with the thin walls, we had to put up with listening to them settle down for about an hour. So all in all, you get what you pay for. $63 including all taxes - I'd rather pay $40 more and get a goodnite elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: flawson
Reviews.Content: The people were pleasant at check-in, and the room was clean and cozy. The pool and jacuzzi are open 24 hrs. Went skinnydipping and no one seemed to care .. I thought that was pretty cool. I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Bad Nite Hotel not a Good Nite...”
Reviews.Author: stefi73
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend this "place" to spend any night. We spent one night of our honeymoon there and it was the most horrible place and night we had. We had booked a KING BED size and they gave us a not even a queen size. The sheets were not changed, my wife found blond hair from who knows,...there was a bug in the bathroom, the bathroom tub was in a bad shape, the sink dripped all night and there were very noisy people outside our door all night. People were walking and talking loud and the phone rang at 2 am. We hardly got any sleep. THE MOST HORRIBLE THING WAS, what they call "house keeper" opened our door after we told her NOT TO COME IN and she still opened the door while we were undressed. We were so angry ! When I gave back the key I told at the front desk all about the situation and room condition and that I am going to leave a very bad feedback about the hotel and the very poor house keeping service. I have photo proofs of the place and I RECOMMEND NOT TO GO THERE unless you want to have a BAD NITE in what they call "Good Nite" Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, location, and a pleasent stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location to Six Flags was wonderful, Right off the highway so it was easy to find and easy to commute, a new McDonalds across the street, room was always cleaned and fresh towels everyday, the staff was friendly, & they had security on the weekend that only allowed the guest to come it. The hotel is located in a somewhat rundown so don't expect the red carpet. So if your looking for a good deal this is a good place to stay. I was worried about this hotel at first, probably like many others. Great deals don't have frills and yes some bad things MAY happen, but this hotel was great for us. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “listen to these reviews I didnt and payed for it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had checked this site for the reviews and figured I only needed to sleep at this place for 1 night so I ignored the bad reviews. That was a bad idea. The room was bad, the hotel clerk is rude I could deal with that but the sleep was horrible. They actully rented a room with a broken window. I mean broken not cracked, they just taped the piece back on with clear tape. I didnt think it was going to be a big problem so I stayed there. The chairs are disgusting with all kinds of stains. I had to cover them with towels. The room smelled like cigarettes even though it was a non smoking room. The carpet was disgusting do not walk barefooted. The bathroom floor was stained. There was someones elses shavings all around the sink. But the worst was that you could not sleep!!! The hotel is right next to the interstate 5. It is loud especialy with a broken window. The floors are thin and I could hear the person upstairs every single time they would move on the bed because the springs on the bed are horrible!! DEFINITELY NOT A GOOD NITE!!! I only got 3 hours sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Don't come here if you need internet service!”
Reviews.Author: bmweerman
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on price and the fact that they had wireless broadband. We arrived fairly late in the evening and were given a smoking room when that is not what we booked and it was horrible. To her credit the young lady at the front desk did manage to get us another room after several complaints. I would not reccommend this hotel to anyone...if all you want to do is sleep you might be ok if you stayed on the east side as the west side faces I-5. We weren't particularly inteterested in amenities and the hotel could have been alright for the price except for the fact that the internet only worked for a out a couple of hours while we were there. I brought this to the attention of the mangagemnet who seems to be under the impression that just because he is transmitting a signal means the room can connect. Not True!! Something as simple as resetting the router might have solved this problem but was not done. Clean enough I suppose but the shower was plumbed backwards and only a trickle of water came out. Also, would not do Yoga on the carpet if I were you. For my money...spend a couple extra bucks and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “OK if all you need is a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently had to stay over in the LA area over the weekend. I was traveling by myself and I stayed at this hotel. I knew it wasn't going to be the poshest of accomodations when I booked through Hotels so I wasn't too upset when I got to my room. I had asked for a non-smoking room but the room reeked of stale smoke (esp. the bathroom). Someone had carved grafitti into the inside of the door and the screens on my window were broken. THere were stains on the cieling and obvious red wine stains scrubbed out of the bathroom counter. The linen really stank of cigerette smoke as well and the bed was pretty stiff. I was a bit nervous by the neighborhood, but basically it was a quiet night and no one bothered me. I got into my hotel at midnight. There was a security staff patrolling the parking lot at night, but that actually made me feel better about staying there. They were nice enough. If you just need a quick place to stay off of the 405 near the valley then this is an ok solution. It definitely wasn't great, I probably would stay here again if I needed to save money. It was cheap.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i have actually stayed at this hotel 3times and everytime that i have stayed there i have enjoyed my visit the front desk are always friendly everytime i have went. they are located in a good location. for those who said bad remarks im sorry for you. you must have picked a wrong time to go. like ive said before i have stayed at this hotel three times and i have enjoyed it all three times. nice swimming pool, spa, elevator, clear everytime ive been there. yes its not good about the deposit for the remote control nor the telephone but you do get ur deposit back however i have no need for those things so it doesnt bother me

Reviews.Title: “looks good in the pictures, but that's all”
Reviews.Author: squeezeball
Reviews.Content: Looks good in the pictures, but isn't well maintained and once they have your money, just don't care. Reserved two rooms online.. at check in had to pay full amount upfront. Checked in at 3:30pm and one of our rooms wasn't ready yet. When it was eventually ready 1.5 hours later, it had a strong chemical smell and we had to leave the bathroom fan running. The tv in one of the rooms didn't work using the remote and it couldn't be used manually because most of the buttons were missing. When we complained to the front desk they supplied us with three extra remotes, none of which worked either,(the problem was the tv not the remotes), they wouldn't send someone to check the tv, wouldn't replace the tv with one that worked and wouldn't give us a different room. All the doors have good locks with electronic card key access and peep holes, but the rooms have windows that are single pain aluminum sliders. There is no secure place to lock up valuables when you are not in the room. Seems to be the place to stay if you like wild parties. Had a wild party in the room next door that kept spilling out into the common area out side our room. The loud music, shouting, and banging on the walls carried on until 4AM. Random calls to our room (guess who made those) until 2:30AM. So much for the security guard.

Reviews.Title: “They Didn't Honor the Online Rate!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I made a reservation online, I was quoted at $40/night, but our total came up to about $100. I even printed out a confirmation paper w/ the price on it. It's not a big difference monetarily, but we were fumed that they did not honor the advertised online price. The front desk person said, "Oh I'm sorry our rates should have never been advertised that low." As far as the room goes, it was dirty all around. The bathrooms, sink, carpet... The sheets/comforter (if you can call it that), had holes in it. The telephone and carpet had cigarette burns. The worst part was that the room reeked of smoke. It should be illegal to make people stay in a room that dirty.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: mom57
Reviews.Content: We paid a great internet price and the old saying goes "you get what you pay for". The outside looks good. The inside was decent, it was older and appeared to be clean but it had this strange kind of smell and then I figured it out-it was urine with deodorizer covering it. The sheets were clean, the comforter had a hole in it. We've been in luxury hotels and in dumps and this was on the lower scale but it was cheap and we were on a strict budget. I'd suggest going early, check out the room and ask to move to a better one-if you can find it.

Reviews.Title: “No Relief at "Good?" Nite Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived 7/6/04 for one long terrible night. Upon check-in, noticed dirty sheets and a butchered bathroom (cut and paste mosaic floor with grout splattered everywhere) with remnant feces floating in clogged toilet. Called front desk and they said they would get me a plunger for toilet. Three hours later there was no plunger and our bladders were full. Visited front desk to request plunger and were told we were out of luck - no plunger and no alternate bathroom to use. Told them this was unacceptable and our bladders were about to burst in the front lobby. Finally, they relented and said we could use the toilet in a room on the other side of the complex. I asked them again to please plunge the toilet as we didn't want to traipse across complex in the middle of the night to relieve ourselves. He said they were sold out and we were lucky to gain access to this faraway room -but only until the guests showed up! Luckily, nature didn't call during the night and we checked out first thing in the morning. Upon checkout, I mentioned our terrible experience and front desk said there was no maintenance staff to rectify the problem (and no apology either). I said this was unacceptable and she said "okay, I'll give you a 20% credit." It definitely wasn't the "Good" Nite Inn.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a highly unpleasant experience at the Motel 6 next door (see my review on this site), we considered ourselves lucky to find a room here at 10:00 on a Friday night. It was an OK room, but if you are looking for value and a clean room for the night this place is for you.

HotelInfo.Name: Good Nite Inn Sylmar
HotelInfo.Address: 12835 Encinitas Road, Los Angeles, CA 91342
